etymologies: late Middle English (originally in the sense ‘person entrusted with a secret’): from late Latin secretarius ‘confidential officer’, from Latin secretum ‘secret’, neuter of secretus (see secret)

definitions: a person employed by an individual or in an office to assist with correspondence, keep records, make appointments, and carry out similar tasks.
shortDefinitions: person employed by individual or in office to assist with correspondence

definitions: an official of a society or other organization who conducts its correspondence and keeps its records.
shortDefinitions: official of society or other organization who conducts its correspondence and keeps its records

definitions: an official in charge of a government department
shortDefinitions: official in charge of government department

definitions: a writing desk with shelves on top of it.
shortDefinitions: writing desk with shelves on top of it
